DataElement.preferredName: Skin Graft Versus Host Disease Clinician Report Clinical Severity Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a clinician reported subjective assessment of the patient's degree of disease activity on the skin caused by Graft versus Host Disease (GVHD).  This is part of the Chronic GVHD Composite Assessment Scale evaluation tool, but does not contribute to that score.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Skin Graft Versus Host Disease Clinician Report Clinical Severity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: 1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part._An incompatibility reaction (which may be fatal) in a subject (host) of low immunological competence (deficient lymphoid tissue) who has been the recipient of immunologically competent lymphoid tissue from a donor who lacks at least one antigen possessed by the recipient host; the reaction, or disease, is the result of action of the transplanted cells against those host tissues that possess the antigen not possessed by the donor. Seen most commonly following bone marrow transplantation, acute disease is seen after 5-40 days and chronic disease weeks to months after transplantation, affecting, principally, the gastrointestinal tract, liver, and skin__A physician who is involved in the treatment and observation of patients as part of a systematic investigation._A short textual account; having provided a short account._Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: 1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part.:An incompatibility reaction (which may be fatal) in a subject (host) of low immunological competence (deficient lymphoid tissue) who has been the recipient of immunologically competent lymphoid tissue from a donor who lacks at least one antigen possessed by the recipient host; the reaction, or disease, is the result of action of the transplanted cells against those host tissues that possess the antigen not possessed by the donor. Seen most commonly following bone marrow transplantation, acute disease is seen after 5-40 days and chronic disease weeks to months after transplantation, affecting, principally, the gastrointestinal tract, liver, and skin.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

A reaction, which may be fatal, in an immunocompromised subject (host) who has received an antigenically incompatible tissue transplant (graft) from an immunocompetent donor. The reaction is secondary to the activation of the transplanted cells against those host tissues that express an antigen not expressed by the donor, and is seen most commonly following bone marrow transplantation; acute disease is seen after 5-40 days, and chronic disease occurs weeks to months after transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: A physician who is involved in the treatment and observation of patients as part of a systematic investigation.:Report; a short account.:Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.

Concepts.definition: A physician who is involved in the treatment and observation of patients as part of a systematic investigation.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.
Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Scale Chronic Graft versus Host Disease Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases.  Onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Scale Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Score
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: an ordered reference standard.:A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases.  Onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support CCR Transplantation trial.
